value.title: Visually impaired persons try their hand at offering massage therapy
value.excerpt: Massage therapy business is among the most affected businesses as it was restricted severally yet the business has been increasingly viable for visually impaired people. Beth Gatonye, founder of Seeing Hands Rwanda- an organization aimed to improve the social and economic wellbeing of people with visual impairments-said that she runs a massage therapy centre that employs visually impaired people but where operations were severely affected following the Covid-19 pandemic times.
